definition: to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: It is beyond students' ability to accomplish two tasks simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 對於學生來說，一心二用是強其所難。

sentences.english: Juggle two tasks at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 一心二用，同時進行兩項工作。

definition: to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted
lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions/to be observant and alert (idiom)
pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1

definition: to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
one cannot concentrate on two things at the same time
to operate (a machine etc) with ease
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused
ten lines at a glance (idiom)/to read very rapidly
